definition: to skimp on the job and stint on materials (idiom)/jerry-building/sloppy work
to steal/to pilfer/to snatch/thief/stealthily
work/worker/skill/profession/trade/craft/labor
to lower/to decrease/to reduce/to subtract/to diminish
material/stuff/grain/feed/to expect/to anticipate/to guess

sentences.english: The complexity of a jerry-rigged firewall will undermine its effectiveness.
sentences.chinese: 一個偷工減料的防火牆，其複雜性將削弱其效力。

sentences.english: Those collapsed houses were all jerry-built.
sentences.chinese: 那些倒塌的房子都是偷工減料蓋的。

sentences.english: Ultra low prices very likely " jerry-built".
sentences.chinese: 超低價格極有可能是“偷工減料”。

sentences.english: Then, in building materials, buildings, the construction of shoddy work.
sentences.chinese: 然後，在建築材料上以次充好，施工上偷工減料。

sentences.english: There's no scrimping and saving on this board.
sentences.chinese: 有沒有偷工減料，並在此板儲蓄。

sentences.english: Some workers to cut corners, in white latex confirmed in water.
sentences.chinese: 有些工人爲了偷工減料，在白乳膠中兌水。

sentences.english: Zhang Rui said that the cabinet industry's most prone to the problem of shoddy work.
sentences.chinese: 張銳表示，櫥櫃行業最容易出現的問題是偷工減料。

sentences.english: Those dishonest builders always try to cut corners.
sentences.chinese: 那些存心不良的建築商老想偷工減料。

sentences.english: Ono Custom Rods thanks Jerry for this history lesson.
sentences.chinese: 大野功統習俗棒感謝偷工減料，爲這個歷史的教訓。

definition: business activity/commercial activity
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
abbr. for 違章建築|违章建筑, illegal construction
arbitrary/subjective/dogmatic
workplace overseer/foreman
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to deceive/to conceal
environmental impact
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
out of order (of machine)/not working properly/a failing (of a system)
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
safety issue/security issue
to pile up like a mountain (idiom)/a mountain of (paperwork etc)/a large number of sth
to whine on for days (idiom)/to endlessly grumble complaints/incessant whining
to boast
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
